meanings.definition: Unleavened bread traditionally eaten during Passover.
meanings.sent1: During Passover, we always have matsah on the table.
meanings.sent2: The matsah was crisp and delicious.
meanings.sent3: The matsah decided to go on a vacation from being eaten during Passover.
meanings.sent4: The matsah, like a loyal friend, stayed by our side throughout the Passover meal.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the matsah filled the room, reminding us of tradition.

meanings.definition: A flat, thin piece of unleavened bread.
meanings.sent1: She placed a piece of matsah on her plate.
meanings.sent2: The matsah broke into smaller pieces as we shared it.
meanings.sent3: The matsah tried to hide under the table, pretending to be a coaster.
meanings.sent4: The matsah, like a delicate leaf, crumbled at the touch.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of the matsah made it a perfect accompaniment to the meal.

meanings.sent1: We will matsah together as a family this year.
meanings.sent2: She loves to matsah with her friends during the holiday.
meanings.sent3: He decided to matsah all day long, just for fun.
meanings.sent4: Matsahing brought them closer as they shared stories around the table.
meanings.sent5: The joy of matsahing filled the kitchen with laughter.
